newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi slams building of Jewish houses in Jerusalem.
newsitem.headline: Saudi slams building of Jewish houses in Jerusalem.

text.p: Saudi Arabia's King Fahd has said Israel's decision to build a new Jewish neighbourhood in mostly Arab East Jerusalem violated peace process agreements as well as the city's Islamic and Arab identity.
King Fahd said the Israeli decision "contravenes completely the resolutions and decisions of the United Nations, the U.N. Security Council and the Madrid peace conference."

It was also "a violation of the international community's unanimous agreement on the preservation of Jerusalem's demographic and geographic features, in terms of its Islamic and Arab identity," he added.
The official Saudi Press Agency said the king was speaking at a weekly cabinet meeting in Riyadh on Monday night.

Israel was set to begin work on Tuesday on the Jewish neighbourhood at a disputed hilltop. The Israeli decision plunged Arab-Israeli ties to their lowest point since the 1993 PLO-Israeli peace accord and angered Arab and Western states.
Under the accord the future of Jerusalem and the fate of Jewish settlements in the West Bank and Gaza will be determined in final status talks that were supposed to have resumed on Monday.
